metadata.Title: CVE-2021-30887 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A logic issue was addressed with improved restrictions. This issue is fixed in macOS Monterey 12.0.1, iOS 15.1 and iPadOS 15.1, watchOS 8.1, tvOS 15.1. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to unexpectedly unenforced Content Security Policy.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-30887` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.34.3-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.34.3-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.34.3-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.34.3-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.34.3-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.34.3-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.34.3-0ubuntu0.21.10.1').
wpewebkit package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
